section: 4.18.5: Applying the inclusion-exclusion principle with three sets.
question: Three employees of a company, Anna, Fred and Jose, have each worked on 12 projects. Each pair of people have worked on 4 together. There is only one project that all three of worked on as a team. What is the total number of projects that any of them have worked on?
explanation:
Answer

25
Let A be the set of projects that Anna has worked on. Let F be the set of projects that Fred has worked on, and let J be the set of projects that Jose has worked on. |A| = |F| = |J| = 12 . |A ∩ F| = |F ∩ J| = |A ∩ J| = 4 . Also, |A ∩ F ∩ J| = 1 . Then |A ∪ F ∪ J| = 12 + 12 + 12 - 4 - 4 - 4 +1 = 25 .
